title: Maxime Bôcher
summary: Maxime Bôcher (August 28, 1867 – September 12, 1918) was an American mathematician who published about 100 papers on differential equations, series, and algebra.[1] He also wrote elementary texts such as Trigonometry and Analytic Geometry.[2] Bôcher's theorem, Bôcher's equation, and the Bôcher Memorial Prize are named after him.
